name: arstechnica
text:
"I was originally going to write this piece as an argument for the one true Batmobile, but the documentary convinced me each iteration of Batman's ride is equally valid.

OK, maybe not the unmodified Cadillac that he used in a 1943 production..." https://t.co/KoJ0iB0DSX

name: arstechnica
text: We're not at #WWDC this year (because no one is), but we'll be following and you can too with our traditional liveblog: 10a PT / 1p ET https://t.co/pyImAIGfCR https://t.co/dn5cE7SK4e

name: arstechnica
text: We will miss the badge style, but there's plenty of other stuff to get excited about even if #WWDC is entirely online this year. We'll liveblog the keynote at 1p ET, meaning there's time to catch up on what to expect right now  https://t.co/BmEblL9dxJ https://t.co/LQDIfyy9D3

name: arstechnica
text: RT @PeteFreedman: TIL the creator of NBA Jam grew up in Detroit and entered code into the game making it harder for Bulls players to hit buzzer-beaters when playing against the Pistons. (This whole @arstechnica video is great, but our focus comes in at the 19:42 mark.) https://t.co/e54LJ4hspB

name: arstechnica
text: Still waiting on the green light for a space elevator, tbh  https://t.co/6ZHG8019gY
